77EB9790ADF248559FF2F9AF7977000E.description: I can explain how the choice of evidence and data can influence interpretations of the past and the present.Â

E8F7AFFC6D3B44C384F939E1166B0683.description: I can identify patterns and processes of human actions and natural forces; their effects can repeat and develop in predictable or unpredictable patterns.

6A55B83725EA448EA28EC110BAD188AA.description: I can analyze the multiple causes and effects of events for insights into patterns of decision making.

A256ED7F4A714C15892E983925B7E971.description: I can compare and contrast continuity and change in organizations and cultures.

15C3CF93881E466DB85557E56C8BC9E1.description: I can make connections between the various social studies disciplines -- political, social, economic, historical, geographical and psychological.

B60CE372E3104D6D835DA62BED6C3877.description: I can explain that people's movement across the earth and how the decisions they make cause events to happen locally, regionally and nationally.

4A009C7104624A11A25EDF7B4F90CDCD.description: I can analyze interactions; contacts among and within groups result in both conflicts and cooperation, often leading to changes.

D743BE0D8E74450CA9974E50677D35FC.description: I can demonstrate that the past, present, future are connected; humans seek to understand the past to inform decision making in the present and plan for the future.
